entities.name: sorting hat
entities.description: The Sorting Hat is a magical object that sorts students into their respective houses. It is mentioned as 'Sorting Hat 95' in the text.

entities.name: corridor
entities.description: A corridor on the right-hand side of the room is out of bounds for everyone who does not wish to die a very painful death. It is mentioned as being off-limits due to unknown reasons.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is one of the few students who wishes to go through the corridor on the right-hand side. He laughs at Dumbledore's warning and mutters to Percy that he doesn't think Dumbledore is serious.

entities.name: percy
entities.description: Percy is a student who is also present in the room. He frowns at Dumbledore and thinks that he might have given them a reason for not going through the corridor.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is the headmaster of Hogwarts School. He warns the students about the corridor on the right-hand side and then leads them in singing the school song.

entities.name: forest
entities.description: The forest is full of dangerous beasts, as mentioned by Percy.

relationships.description: Dumbledore warns the students about the corridor on the right-hand side and says that it is out of bounds for everyone who does not wish to die a very painful death.
Dumbledore warns Harry about the corridor on the right-hand side, but Harry seems unconcerned.
Percy questions Dumbledore's decision to keep the corridor off-limits without giving a reason.
